Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: TEST PERIOD TYPE: This reference table describes a well test time pressure periodtype. For example hydrostatic, shutin, valve open or flowing.
Column Comment.6: PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique observation number assigned to eachperiod.
Column Comment.7: ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number for each unique analysisobservation.
Column Comment.8: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.9: BASIC SEDIMENT AND WATER: Percentage of basic sediment and water. (Solidimpurities and salt water that are mixed with crude oil.)
Column Comment.10: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.11: CONDENSATE GRAVITY OUOM: Condensate gravity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: CONDENSATE RATIO: The condensate-gas ratio (the ratio of condensate producedat a unit of gas).
Column Comment.13: CONDENSATE RATIO OUOM: Condensate gas ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: CONDENSATE TEMPERATURE: Temperature at which the API of the condensatewas measured.
Column Comment.15: CONDENSATE TEMPERATURE OUOM: Condensate temperature original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.16: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.17: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.18: FLUID TYPE: The type of fluid or substance produced by a well or used for variousoperations. For example oil, gas, mud or water. NOTE: The reference tableassociated with this column is still being evaluated for possible subtyping.
Column Comment.19: GAS CONTENT: Identifies the gas content of the sample in terms of accessoryconstituents such as, H2S, CO2, etc. This is a Permian Basin only data element.
Column Comment.20: GAS GRAVITY: The API gravity of gas. It is computed by dividing the specific gravityof the gas at 60 degrees F into 141.5 then subtracting 131.5.
Column Comment.21: GAS OIL RATIO: Value for the gas oil ratio (the amount of natural gas divided by theamount of crude oil).
Column Comment.22: GAS OIL RATIO OUOM: Gas oil ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: GAS WATER RATIO: The gas water ratio (the volumetric ratio of dissolved gas towater in the sample).
Column Comment.24: GAS WATER RATIO OUOM: Gas water ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: H2S PERCENTAGE: Percentage of hydrogen sulfide (H2S) in the fluid type (theabundance of H2S in the fluid expressed as weight percentage).
Column Comment.26: LIQUID GAS RATIO: The liquid gas ratio determined during the well test analysis
Column Comment.27: LIQUID GAS RATIO OUOM: Liquid gas ratio original unit of measure.
Column Comment.28: OIL DENSITY: Density or mass per unit volume of the crude oil.
Column Comment.29: OIL DENSITY OUOM: Oil density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.30: OIL GRAVITY: The API gravity of oil. It is computed by dividing the specific gravity ofthe oil at 60 degrees F into 141.5 then subtracting 131.5.
Column Comment.31: OIL TEMPERATURE: Temperature at which the API gravity of the oil is measured.
Column Comment.32: OIL TEMPERATURE OUOM: Oil temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.33: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.34: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.35: SALINITY TYPE: The type of water salinity measurement techniques used for welltests and sample analysis. For example, chlorides, total dissolved solids...
Column Comment.36: SULPHUR PERCENTAGE: Percentage of sulfur in the fluid (the relativeconcentration of total sulfur in the fluid, expressed as weight percent).
Column Comment.37: WATER CUT: The fraction of water volume produced from a well.
Column Comment.38: WATER RESISTIVITY: The formation water resistivity (the measurement of theresistance of water to the passage of electricity).
Column Comment.39: WATER RESISTIVITY OUOM: Water resistivity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.40: WATER SALINITY PERCENTAGE: Percentage of water salinity (the total weight ofdissolved salts in the water).
Column Comment.41: WATER SALINITY OUOM: Salinity original unit of measure.
Column Comment.42: WATER TEMPERATURE: Temperature of the water sample at the time its resistivitywas measured.
Column Comment.43: WATER TEMPERATURE OUOM: Water temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.44: WATER OIL RATIO: Water oil ratio (the number of barrels of water divided by thenumber of stock tank barrels of oil that the well produces).
Column Comment.45: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.46: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.47: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.48: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.49: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.50: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.51: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
